Beholder 2: Ohh, like somebody blew me up and I was pieced back together.
Who are you?...
----- Original Message -----
From: <logomorph@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, November 15, 2000 5:16 PM
Subject: Allience


> Squizzy::
>
> She checked on the clones. Beholder was now complete. But Feline was
> only at 55% complete.
>
> She opened up the tank and got the Beholder clone out of the tank. He
> was very heavy, but she finally managed to get it up onto a table.
> She opened up the chest panels.  She hooked up an energon IV up to
> the bot.  She carefully removed the cloned mother board and installed
> the original board. She then hooked up two cables to the bot's head
> and went over to the console. She inserted the memory disk and
> started to download the old memories and programs. She also installed
> an anitvirus program. So that the bot won't get any programming
> viruses in the furture. It's programs would remain intact no matter
> what.
>
> She knew the computer would take a few  minutes to finish the
> download. She walked over and started on the other upgrades. She
> adjusted the shoulders to have a jet pack and shoulder cannons.
>
> A few hours later, she was finished. She looked at the bot on the
> table.  It was now fully ready to activate. She went over and looked
> at the spark chamber.  She needed to have this bot working on it's
> own and not under another bots control. She went over to the original
> body of Beholder and took out the old spark chamber. She then removed
> the clone's spark chamber and installed the original chamber in the
> clone.  She then added liquid energon into the spark chamber. Then
> closed the chamber and the chest panels.
>
> With little time to waste, she removed all the connections and IV's
> to the bot. Next, she put four electrodes on the bot's chest. She hit
> a few buttons on the console and flooded the bot's body with pure
> energy.  Three zaps  and she turned off the power.  She removed the
> electrodes and put everything away. She walked over to the bot. It's
> eyes were flickering as the power surged through it.  She knew that a
> new spark was forming in the old spark chamber.  She smiled.
> She gently touched the bot's face and then walked over to her console.
> She sent a message to Zardus that one clone was now alive and ready.
> The bot would wake up any second now.
>
> She walked back over to the Beholder clone. "How are you feeling?"
>
>
>
>
>
